metadata.title: CVE-2024-50293 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/smc: do not leave a dangling sk pointer in __smc_create()Thanks to commit 4bbd360a5084 ("socket: Print pf->create() whenit does not clear sock->sk on failure."), syzbot found an issue withAF_SMC:smc_create must clear sock->sk on failure, family: 43, type: 1, protocol: 0 WARNING: CPU: 0 PID: 5827 at net/socket.c:1565 __sock_create+0x96f/0xa30net/socket.c:1563Modules linked in:CPU: 0 UID: 0 PID: 5827 Comm: syz-executor259 Not tainted6.12.0-rc6-next-20241106-syzkaller #0Hardware name: Google Google Compute Engine/Google Compute Engine, BIOSGoogle 09/13/2024 RIP: 0010:__sock_create+0x96f/0xa30 net/socket.c:1563Code: 03 00 74 08 4c 89 e7 e8 4f 3b 85 f8 49 8b 34 24 48 c7 c7 40 89 0c 8d8b 54 24 04 8b 4c 24 0c 44 8b 44 24 08 e8 32 78 db f7 90 <0f> 0b 90 90 e9d3 fd ff ff 89 e9 80 e1 07 fe c1 38 c1 0f 8c ee f7RSP: 0018:ffffc90003e4fda0 EFLAGS: 00010246RAX: 099c6f938c7f4700 RBX: 1ffffffff1a595fd RCX: ffff888034823c00RDX: 0000000000000000 RSI: 0000000000000000 RDI: 0000000000000000RBP: 00000000ffffffe9 R08: ffffffff81567052 R09: 1ffff920007c9f50R10: dffffc0000000000 R11: fffff520007c9f51 R12: ffffffff8d2cafe8R13: 1ffffffff1a595fe R14: ffffffff9a789c40 R15: ffff8880764298c0FS:  000055557b518380(0000) GS:ffff8880b8600000(0000)knlGS:0000000000000000CS:  0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033CR2: 00007fa62ff43225 CR3: 0000000031628000 CR4: 00000000003526f0DR0: 0000000000000000 DR1: 0000000000000000 DR2: 0000000000000000DR3: 0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 0000000000000400Call Trace: <TASK>  sock_create net/socket.c:1616 [inline]  __sys_socket_create net/socket.c:1653 [inline]  __sys_socket+0x150/0x3c0 net/socket.c:1700  __do_sys_socket net/socket.c:1714 [inline]  __se_sys_socket net/socket.c:1712 [inline]For reference, see commit 2d859aff775d ("Merge branch'do-not-leave-dangling-sk-pointers-in-pf-create-functions'")

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-50293` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1004-kvm - 5.13.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-1005-aws - 5.13.0-1005.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1006-azure - 5.13.0-1006.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1011-bluefield - 5.15.0-1011.13
Available for NVIDIA BlueField platforms

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1005-gcp - 5.13.0-1005.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-gkeop - 5.15.0-1001.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-22.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1005-nvidia - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1005-nvidia-64k - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1008-oracle - 5.13.0-1008.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-19.19').
